org.kitteh.irc.client.library

Interface Client


  • public interface Client
    An individual IRC connection, see builder() to create one.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

    • Method Detail

      • builder

        @Nonnull
static ClientBuilder builder()
        Creates a ClientBuilder to build clients.
        Returns:
        a client builder

      • addChannel

        void addChannel(@Nonnull
                String... channels)
        Adds channels to this client.

        Joins the channel if already connected.

        Parameters:
        channels - channel(s) to add
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if null

      • addChannel

        default void addChannel(@Nonnull
                        Channel... channels)
        Adds channels to this client.

        Joins the channel if already connected.

        Parameters:
        channels - channel(s) to add
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if null

        @Nonnull
AuthManager getAuthManager()
        Gets the authentication manager.
        Returns:
        auth manager

      • getCapabilityManager

        @Nonnull
CapabilityManager getCapabilityManager()
        Gets the capability manager.
        Returns:
        the capability manager

      • getChannel

        @Nonnull
Optional<Channel> getChannel(@Nonnull
                                       String name)
        Gets the named channel.
        Parameters:
        name - channel name
        Returns:
        a channel snapshot of the named channel if tracked by the client
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if name is null
        See Also:
        getChannels()

      • getChannels

        @Nonnull
Set<Channel> getChannels()
        Gets the channels in which the client is currently present.
        Returns:
        the client's current channels

      • getEventManager

        @Nonnull
EventManager getEventManager()
        Gets the client's event manager.
        Returns:
        the event manager for this client

      • getIntendedNick

        @Nonnull
String getIntendedNick()
        Gets the nickname the client intends to possess. May not reflect the current nickname if it's taken. The client will automatically attempt to take back this nickname.

        Use getNick() for the current nick.

        Returns:
        the nickname the client tries to maintain

      • getISupportManager

        @Nonnull
ISupportManager getISupportManager()
        Gets the manager of ISUPPORT info.
        Returns:
        the ISUPPORT manager

      • getMessageDelay

        int getMessageDelay()
        Gets the delay between messages sent to the server.

        Default is 1200ms.

        Returns:
        milliseconds between sent messages

      • getMessageTagManager

        @Nonnull
MessageTagManager getMessageTagManager()
        Gets the message tag manager.
        Returns:
        message tag manager

      • getName

        @Nonnull
String getName()
        Gets the client name. This name is just an internal name for reference and is not visible from IRC.
        Returns:
        the client name

      • getNick

        @Nonnull
String getNick()
        Gets the current nickname the client has.
        Returns:
        the current nick

      • getServerInfo

        @Nonnull
ServerInfo getServerInfo()
        Gets information about the server to which the client is currently connected. As long as the client remains connected the information returned by this object will update according to information received from the server. A new one can be acquired from ClientConnectedEvent
        Returns:
        the server information object

      • getUser

        @Nonnull
Optional<User> getUser()
        Gets the User that the client is represented by. Will return Optional.EMPTY until the Client is in a Channel for which joining has completed, meaning full user info is available.
        Returns:
        the user of this client if known

      • isUser

        default boolean isUser(@Nonnull
                       User user)
        Checks to see if this client is the same as the given user.
        Parameters:
        user - user to check this client against
        Returns:
        true if this client is the user, false if not
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if user null or from different Client

      • knockChannel

        void knockChannel(@Nonnull
                  String channelName)
        KNOCKs on a +i (but not +p) channel, requesting an INVITE.
        Parameters:
        channelName - The channel to send the KNOCK for.

      • removeChannel

        void removeChannel(@Nonnull
                   String channel)
        Removes a channel from the client, leaving as necessary.
        Parameters:
        channel - channel to leave
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if arguments are null

                   @Nonnull

      • sendCTCPMessage

        void sendCTCPMessage(@Nonnull
                     String target,
                     @Nonnull
                     String message)
        Sends a CTCP message to a target user or channel. Automagically adds the CTCP delimiter around the message and escapes the characters that need escaping when sending a CTCP message.

        Note: CTCP replies should not be sent this way. Catch the message with the PrivateCTCPQueryEvent

        Parameters:
        target - the destination of the message
        message - the message to send
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - for null parameters

      • sendCTCPMessage

        default void sendCTCPMessage(@Nonnull
                             MessageReceiver target,
                             @Nonnull
                             String message)
        Sends a CTCP message to a target user or channel. Automagically adds the CTCP delimiter around the message and escapes the characters that need escaping when sending a CTCP message.

        Note: CTCP replies should not be sent this way. Catch the message with the PrivateCTCPQueryEvent

        Parameters:
        target - the destination of the message
        message - the message to send
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - for null parameters

        Sends a message to a target user or channel.

      • sendRawLine

        void sendRawLine(@Nonnull
                 String message)
        Sends a raw IRC message.
        Parameters:
        message - message to send
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if message is null

      • sendRawLineAvoidingDuplication

        void sendRawLineAvoidingDuplication(@Nonnull
                                    String message)
        Sends a raw IRC message, unless the exact same message is already in the queue of messages not yet sent.
        Parameters:
        message - message to send
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if message is null

      • sendRawLineImmediately

        void sendRawLineImmediately(@Nonnull
                            String message)
        Sends a raw IRC message, disregarding message delays and all sanity. Live life on the wild side with this method designed to ensure you get flood-kicked before you finish dumping your life's work into chat.
        Parameters:
        message - message to send dangerously, you monster
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if message is null

      • setExceptionListener

        void setExceptionListener(@Nonnull
                          Consumer<Exception> listener)
        Sets a listener for all thrown exceptions on this client.

        All exceptions are passed from a single, separate thread.

        Parameters:
        listener - catcher of throwable objects

      • setInputListener

        void setInputListener(@Nonnull
                      Consumer<String> listener)
        Sets a listener for all incoming messages from the server.

        All messages are passed from a single, separate thread.

        Parameters:
        listener - input listener

      • setMessageDelay

        void setMessageDelay(int delay)
        Sets the delay between messages sent to the server.

        Default is 1200ms.

        Parameters:
        delay - milliseconds between sent messages

      • setNick

        void setNick(@Nonnull
             String nick)
        Sets the nick the client wishes to use.
        Parameters:
        nick - new nickname
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if nick is null

      • setOutputListener

        void setOutputListener(@Nonnull
                       Consumer<String> listener)
        Sets a listener for all outgoing messages to the server.

        All messages are passed from a single, separate thread.

        Parameters:
        listener - output listener

      • shutdown

        void shutdown()
        Shuts down the client without a quit message.

      • shutdown

        void shutdown(@Nonnull
              String reason)
        Shuts down the client.
        Parameters:
        reason - quit message to send
